turn the work so the 2 ends are on top so we can start slip_stitch to join 4 starting from the top right corner put your crochet hook through the 1st st of the front and back pieces take the yarn pull front and back together 15 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 6 when you reach the end chain 1 cut the yarn and fasten_off weave in all of your ends 7 this is how it should once we finish slip_stitch across 8 and this is the good side 16 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 the tassels in this part we re going to create and attach the tassels of course you can leave them out if you don t like them i always create my tassels with my hairpin crochet tool because i can make them in any size i prefer but you can make them with any tool that you have in order to get even tassels i always count the number of times i wrap the yarn around my tool if you ve never worked a tassel before you ll find the following video tutorial very helpful https //youtu be/lmf50hpeo30 1 make 3 tassels or as many as you prefer 2 take the snood find the one side where we have worked the slip_stitch to join go across to the other end and that s where we re going to attach the tassels make sure that you have the side that we started crocheting on top and the last row of the project in the bottom as shown in the pic below 17 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 3 attach the first st marker in the top right corner the open up the work and attach the st markers 18 st apart from either side you can always leave a bigger distance between them 4 take the tassels and pull them through each marked st and tie them on the cowl 5 weave the ends in the tassel so they aren t visible 18 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 6 this is
